private_information: I know the available actions and their argument signatures: paltry(obj0,obj1,obj2), sip(obj0,obj1,obj2), clip(obj0,obj1,obj2), wretched(obj0,obj1,obj2,obj3), memory(obj0,obj1,obj2), tightfisted(obj0,obj1,obj2).

I know the precondition patterns and the postcondition patterns described in the use case. Preconditions are conjunctions of predicates such as hand, cats, texture, vase, next, sneeze, stupendous, spring, collect. Effects toggle some next relations and toggle vase relations as described.
I will produce a structured description of each action in terms of formal preconditions and add and delete effects. I will not emit PDDL by myself.
player.goal: Provide a clear structured action model describing preconditions and effects for all actions mentioned so an orchestrator can compile a PDDL domain.

private_information: I hold the initial world statements and the two alternative scenarios presented in the statement blocks. Scenario A initial facts: cats object_0, collect object_10 object_2, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_1, collect object_8 object_2, collect object_9 object_2, hand object_11, hand object_12, next object_0 object_5, next object_11 object_9, next object_12 object_10, next object_3 object_6, next object_4 object_8, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_8, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_10, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9. Scenario A goal: next object_11 object_7 and next object_12 object_5.

Scenario B initial facts: cats object_0, collect object_10 object_2, collect object_5 object_1, collect object_6 object_1, collect object_7 object_1, collect object_8 object_2, collect object_9 object_2, hand object_11, hand object_12, next object_0 object_8, next object_11 object_6, next object_12 object_10, next object_3 object_7, next object_4 object_10, sneeze object_3, sneeze object_4, spring object_5, spring object_8, stupendous object_1, stupendous object_2, texture object_10, texture object_5, texture object_6, texture object_7, texture object_8, texture object_9. Scenario B goal: next object_11 object_7 and next object_12 object_8.
I will provide the initial facts and the goal statements as structured fact lists for the orchestrator. I will not emit PDDL by myself.
state_keeper.goal: Provide a clean machine readable representation of the initial facts and the two goal variants so the orchestrator can produce PDDL problem files.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate the action model and the initial state representations to produce a PDDL domain and one or more PDDL problem files suitable for the FastDownwards planner that achieve the specified goals.

init.note: This environment is a relational blocklike domain with many object constants named object_0 through object_12.

public_information: There is a set of objects named object_0 through object_12.
Predicates in the domain include hand, cats, texture, vase, next, sneeze, stupendous, spring, collect.
Available actions are paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, tightfisted with the argument arities described by the player agent.
Actions change next relations and vase relations according to the use case. Some actions require hand or sneeze or specific texture or collect or stupendous or spring facts.
Two alternative initial statements and goals are provided in the scenario. The orchestrator should be able to produce PDDL problems for each scenario.

model.system_prompt: You are an expert in formalizing action schemas. Do not emit PDDL. Produce a structured JSON-like description for each action listing its typed parameters, positive preconditions, negative preconditions if any, add effects, and delete effects inferred from the use-case. Keep actions distinct and keep predicate names identical to those in the public information. If information is ambiguous, describe the ambiguity explicitly and provide conservative preconditions and effects.
model.prompt: Agent name: player. Use the environment public information: {environment->public_information}. Use your private information: {agents->player->private_information}. The overall orchestration goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Produce a structured action model for paltry, sip, clip, wretched, memory, and tightfisted. Output the model as a clear structured object describing parameters, preconditions, add effects, and delete effects for each action. Do not output PDDL.

state.system_prompt: You are an expert in encoding initial states and goals. Do not emit PDDL. Produce a structured list of ground facts for each provided scenario and a clear representation of the corresponding goals. If there are multiple statements, label them ScenarioA and ScenarioB. Do not make unstated assumptions.
state.prompt: Agent name: state_keeper. Use the environment public information: {environment->public_information}. Use your private information: {agents->state_keeper->private_information}. The overall orchestration goal: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Produce a structured representation of the initial facts and the two goal variants. Label them ScenarioA and ScenarioB. Do not output PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in compiling multiagent models into PDDL targeting the FastDownwards solver. You must produce a PDDL domain and one or more PDDL problem files suitable for FastDownwards. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and each PDDL problem between <problem id="..."></problem> tags. Keep action names and predicate names consistent with the player and state representations. Preserve agent distinctions in action names by prefixing actions with agent identifiers if necessary. If there are multiple scenarios provide one problem per scenario. The final artifacts should be directly usable by FastDownwards.
pddl.prompt: Agent name: orchestrator. You receive the following artifacts from other agents. Player model: {player_model}. State model: {state_model}. Your task is to integrate the action model and the initial state facts to produce a single PDDL domain and one PDDL problem for each scenario for the FastDownwards solver. Keep agent actions distinct if the player model suggested distinctions. Resolve naming ambiguities explicitly and document any assumptions as comments at the top of the domain or problem files. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and each PDDL problem between <problem id="..."></problem> tags.
